author: gtrintinalia
content: Hey Mario, What is your opinion about including "latest" as well? That would ensure clients will have the correct chain of forks. This EIP was thought before we had BPOs

author: _shemnon
content: My thinking for the precompiles having the number first and the system having hte name was that precompiles are in a packed order.   But I see the point of a consistent format. Given that I would want name to be the key and the address is the configuration that changes.  For precompiles their presence or absence is the configuration as much as the address.

author: marioevz
content: No objection, it would be helpful for devnets mostly where the BPOs are closer together I think, wdyt <@412614104222531604>

author: marioevz
content: Will push this change, and also the `lastHash` + `lastForkId` improvement if everyone is ok with them

author: barnabasbusa
content: updated with this pr the scope of devnet-3

author: marioevz
content: We are working on a command that you can use to test configs on the devnet

author: marioevz
content:
If anyone wants to try out their implementation of `eth_config` (and also help me verify our new eest command) [install uv](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/getting-started/installation/) and then run:
```bash
uv run --with git+https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests.git@execute-eth-config execute eth-config --network Mainnet --rpc-endpoint http://<ETH_RPC_ENDPOINT>
```
